article:
"'The State'" is a fictional totalitarian world government in a future history
that forms the back-story of three of Larry Niven's novels: [[A World Out of
Time]] (1976), [[The Integral Trees]] (1984), and [[The Smoke Ring (novel)|The
Smoke Ring]] (1987). It is also the setting of two short stories, "Rammer"
(which became the first chapter of A World Out of Time) and "The Kiteman"
(printed in [[N-Space (short story collection)|N-Space]]) as well as a stalled
fourth novel, The Ghost Ships. After several years in development, Niven
announced that The Ghost Ships would never be made, and wrote [[The Ringworld
Throne]] instead. [http://www.larryniven.org/larryletters/larryletter16-03-
03.shtml Larry's Letters] The novel would have focused on a race of self-
aware natural ramjets birthed in the supernova that created Levoy's Star and
were returning to their place of birth to mate. [http://web.archi-
ve.org/web/20080521095106/http://www.larryniven.org/chatlogs/iuniversechat.shtml
Iuniverse Chat May 29, 2000] According to [[Playgrounds of the Mind]],
Kendy and the kite-fliers from "The Kiteman" would have returned
also. Playgrounds of the Mind, pp. 693-94
